Sunglasses with built-in magnification: A pair of sunglasses with a built-in magnification feature can be extremely useful for individuals who need to read small print or see details from a distance. This feature can be particularly helpful for people with visual impairments or for those who need to read maps, menus, or labels while on the go.

Sunglasses with a polarized lens: A polarized lens can be an excellent choice for individuals who need to reduce glare and reflection. This type of lens can be particularly helpful for drivers, boaters, or anyone who needs to see clearly in bright, sunny conditions.

Sunglasses with a blue light filter: With the increasing use of technology, many people experience eye strain and fatigue caused by exposure to blue light. Sunglasses with a blue light filter can help to reduce eye strain and improve comfort while using electronic devices.

Sunglasses with a mirror coating: A mirror coating can be a fun and stylish addition to any pair of sunglasses. This feature can be particularly useful for individuals who need to see their reflection while applying makeup or adjusting their hair.

Sunglasses with a detachable camera: A detachable camera can be a unique and functional addition to a pair of sunglasses. This feature can be particularly helpful for photographers, videographers, or anyone who needs to capture images on the go.
